title: Pixel font alternative to Lubalin Graph
content:
Hi everyone,

i am in the process of designing a website for a client who uses various weights of Lubalin Graph for all printed communication.

I’d like to replace the Lubalin with a crisp Pixel font for the use in Flash etc. - any recommendations?

Thanks for your help,

Seb

 [‹ Type Battle! Week 4 (2/6)](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010125404/http:/www.typophile.com/battle04 "Go to previous forum topic") [Dotted Lines in Illustrator ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010125404/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17994 "Go to next forum topic")
author: all about seb

comments.content:
Have a look here- they all appear to be freeware:

[http://www.bestflashanimationsite.com/pixel-fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010125404/http:/www.bestflashanimationsite.com/pixel-fonts/ "http://www.bestflashanimationsite.com/pixel-fonts/")

Thanks for your tips David(s).

Checked all the fonts available at [www.bestflashanimationsite.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010125404/http:/www.bestflashanimationsite.com/ "www.bestflashanimationsite.com"), but nothing came even close. About Hrant fonts, could you please post a link where i can find some of his? They prove difficult to find.

Thanks,

Seb

Well, his (only?) pixel family, [Mana](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010125404/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Mana), is/was available from [Ultrafonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010125404/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Ultrafonts), whose [website](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010125404/http:/www.ultrafonts.com/) seems not to let you past the splash page at the moment.

He has a demo on his [The Microfoundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010125404/http:/themicrofoundry.com/) webiste, [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010125404/http:/www.themicrofoundry.com/manademo/).

Hrant has an e-mail addres on his [website](http://web.archive.org/web/20081010125404/http:/themicrofoundry.com/s_contact.html). I would suggest e-mailing him directly.
